oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Summer F. Slaton to his mother Frances L. Slaton
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This letter was written by Pvt. Summer F. Slaton, Co. K, 21st Ky, Inf. Regt., USA to his mother Frances L. Slaton. Slaton served as a substitute to replace John Pritchett. His letter was written from Pulaski, Tennessee and indicates that he was forced to; serve, He discusses being forced to gnaw on beef bones to satisfy his hunger. He tell his mother, "I have not totched (sic) a card and I never expect to as long as I liv (sic). I have a testament that I found on the battle ground of Atlanta.
